image.altText: A person with long dark hair works on a computer with software code on two screens.

props.synopsis: With job availability in sectors such as healthcare and tech predicted to rise over the next 15 years, there is concern that some students are receiving outdated career guidance.

title.children: Fears Australia's kids aren't ready for jobs like automation engineer

image.altText: Sick Tasmanian devil

props.synopsis: A video showing a heavily emaciated Tasmanian devil is raising awareness on the impact of the deadly devil facial tumour disease.

title.children: 'Alien' Tasmanian devil with 'severe' facial tumour disease spotted on farm

image.altText: The side of a large ship in port.

props.synopsis: Negotiations to lease the newly built Spirit of Tasmania IV ferry have begun, as the state government announces the ship will stay on in Scotland for another month.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania IV ferry to stay in Scotland until late February as lease offer considered

image.altText: a young man with long hair in a washed out photo

props.synopsis: John's brother Tony died in a motorcycle accident in the 1970s. But he's just discovered that parts of his brother's body may have been collected and stored in a museum after his autopsy, without the consent of family.

title.children: 'Traumatic': Family reacts after learning specimen from loved one may be in museum

image.altText: Ben Yole holds bridle of a horse.

props.synopsis: Leading Tasmanian harness racing trainer Ben Yole has had his racing licence disqualified for three years for the mistreatment of horses on his property at Sidmouth, near Launceston.

title.children: Leading harness trainer suspended over 'systemic' horse mistreatment

image.altText: an aerial view of an oyster lease at sunset

props.synopsis: A mystery illness has wiped out millions of dollars of pacific oysters from one of Tasmania's largest oyster-growing areas, leading to veteran growers leaving the industry.

title.children: A mystery illness is wiping out millions of Tasmanian oysters

image.altText: Whisky barrels in a row in the Nant distillery.

props.synopsis: After a criminal investigation was announced almost eight years ago, the man allegedly behind the Nant whisky investment scandal has faced court for the first time.

title.children: Man allegedly behind whisky investment scandal facing 736 charges

image.altText: A woman holds her head in her hands

props.synopsis: When a lawyer told her employer she had been sexually assaulted by a third party while on a work trip, she was supported. But when she put in a workers compensation claim nine months later, her employer decided to dispute it — and won.

title.children: 'I don't know why it has to be this hard': Woman loses compensation fight

image.altText: Floodwaters over a regional airstrip.

props.synopsis: Authorities are set doorknock thousands of homes across Townsville as intense rainfall and flooding continues across north Queensland. Follow live.

title.children: North Queensland likely to start approaching 'major flood event', BOM says

image.altText: US President Donald Trump raises his hand as he addresses journalists

props.synopsis: Early in the week reports of panic selling on Wall Street reverberated around the world but the Australian share market eventually hit an intraday all-time high. What's going on?

title.children: Who’s paying the price for Australia’s record-breaking share market?

image.altText: Liu Dong holds up a small circular food item as she stands in front of a Japanese 7-Eleven, with ads for food around the door.

props.synopsis: Chinese citizens are continuing to migrate to Japan in increasing numbers, hoping to build better lives for family away from the censorship and repressive rule of Xi Jinping.

title.children: As Beijing embraces 'communal wealth', some Chinese people flee to Japan

image.altText: Two smiling women with $20 dresses in a retro ad

props.synopsis: Katies, Millers, Rivers and more have collapsed after decades in Australian fashion. What went wrong?

title.children: Millers and Noni B were the last standing as a business empire crumbled

image.altText: Sam Abdulrahim shirtless with boxing tape around his hands leaning on a ledge.

props.synopsis: Another deadly shooting in 2016 sparked a feud between two underworld figures that would span a decade. Sources believe it may be what led to the killing of Sam "The Punisher" Abdulrahim.

title.children: The feud that ended with the execution of Melbourne's most-hunted man

image.altText: A young white boy with fair hair playing with his parents

props.synopsis: Eddy's mum says he's caught between two systems – and there's concern more cases like his will soon crop up across Australia, write Evan Young and Nas Campanella.

title.children: This boy personifies the NDIS issue expected to dominate 2025

image.altText: 2025-01-30T204648Z_256776295_RC2KKCA2F3WR_RTRMADP_3_USA-TRUMP

props.synopsis: Mexico, Canada and China will face tariffs on exports to the US from Saturday, the White House has confirmed.

title.children: Trump to hit Mexico, Canada and China with US tariffs within hours

image.altText: YanisVaroufakisQA_2024

props.synopsis: Analysts say TikTok's "soap opera" saga in the United States is highlighting the "Hunger Games" for social media dominance, with prominent author and economist Yanis Varoufakis calling for measures to take back control for users.

title.children: Economist wants to deal a 'major blow' to social media platforms

image.altText: Washington DC air disaster

props.synopsis: The chopper was flying above a 200-foot (61-metre) limit on helicopters in the area when it crashed into a passenger plane and killed all on board, the US president says.

title.children: Chopper was 'too high' when it collided with plane near DC, Trump says

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump talking

props.synopsis: Information scrubbed from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) websites included statistics on HIV among transgender people.

title.children: HIV data scrapped from sites ahead of Trump's executive order deadline

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A Ukrainian serviceman patrols a street next to buildings damaged by fighting

props.synopsis: Ukraine believes North Korean soldiers fighting alongside Russia's army on the Kursk front line have been "withdrawn" after suffering heavy losses.

title.children: Ukraine says North Korean soldiers fighting alongside Russia have been withdrawn

image.altText: a nsw police officer stands next to a paddy wagon as he closes the door

props.synopsis: Premier Chris Minns said legislation to boost penalties when it comes to "racist attacks" would also be introduced.

title.children: Police antisemitism task force has numbers doubled

image.altText: police officers look in the boot of a car as a man sits on the ground

props.synopsis: On Thursday night, ABC rode along with the force who are investigating hate crimes with an antisemitic focus via Operation Shelter.

title.children: 'These people are watching us': Inside the operation against antisemitism

image.altText: The wallet lies open on a bench, its contents displayed, including the Video Ezy card.

props.synopsis: When Tim Caesar's wallet flew out his car window at 19 he thought it was gone forever, but three decades later a stranger reunited it with him through a local Facebook group after fishing it out of the Queabeyan River.

title.children: Video Ezy cards, 'decimated' money in 30yo wallet fished from river

image.altText: Sick Tasmanian devil

props.synopsis: A video showing a heavily emaciated Tasmanian devil is raising awareness on the impact of the deadly devil facial tumour disease.

title.children: 'Alien' Tasmanian devil with 'severe' facial tumour disease spotted on farm

image.altText: A PNG man on the street looking angry

props.synopsis: From Timor-Leste to Tonga, aid projects across the region have been put on hold. And those in the sector say "the Trump effect" is starting to have real-life impacts on the ground.

title.children: 'The Trump effect' hits leaving Australia-region aid projects 'scrambling'

image.altText: A boy sits and leans on a crutch with a mother's hands resting on his shoulders.

props.synopsis: Jungle medics and ethnic medical groups have become a lifeline for displaced people in Myanmar as the country becomes the world's deadliest for landmines.

title.children: 'My legs were gone': Hidden danger spreads amid Myanmar war

image.altText: A man with a suit jacket across his face and head walks along a street outside a Perth court.

props.synopsis: How could loving parents starve their only child? It's the key question at the heart of the baffling case of a teenage ballerina whose parents allowed her to become so malnourished she was at risk of cardiac arrest.

title.children: Why would these loving parents starve their only child?

image.altText: Nathan Lyon, Dhananjaya de Silva and Mitchell Starc.

props.synopsis: Mitchell Starc shows his difference as rain and Dinesh Chandimal save the Sri Lankan captain's blushes. Here are the quick hits from day three in Galle.

title.children: Five quick hits: Starc's class apparent as rain spares skipper's shame

image.altText: A purple sky with stars in a whirlwind motion.

props.synopsis: Would people travel to see the Milky Way like they do for the Great Barrier Reef? This tiny town thinks dark sky tourism is the next big thing.

title.children: Outback town looks to the night sky to broaden tourism appeal

image.altText: A police officer stands on the footpath of a road that is blocked by a police car, police tape and orange traffic cones.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the death of a woman in Ascot Vale and a subsequent fatal freeway incident at Little River.

title.children: Man's death linked to discovery of woman's body in Melbourne

image.altText: A water pipeline runs parallel to the Great Eastern Highway in WA.

props.synopsis: In a week that began with WA's power supply under scrutiny, a $100 million proposal to pipe desalinated seawater to Kalgoorlie flew under the radar.

title.children: Resurrected plan to pipe water to WA Goldfields taps tumultuous history

image.altText: a frustrated doctor superimposed over a photo of an emergency department

props.synopsis: After nearly nine years and almost $300 million spent, the first stage of the NT government's five-stage Acacia project has barely been completed, with the system currently suspended at the NT's busiest emergency department.

title.children: The Acacia 'shemozzle': How an NT Health software upgrade went so wrong

image.altText: A young woman in a re blazer speaks to the media, behind her are other young women and parliamentarians

props.synopsis: The new body will have investigative powers similar to a royal commission.

title.children: 'Not a bad thing to complain': National Student Ombudsman opens its doors today

image.altText: Colourful illustration of person laying on beach seen from top of head, wearing large hat and holding book above their face.

props.synopsis: Dive into our summer reading guide featuring slow-burn romantasy, suspenseful crime fiction and a captivating cult Japanese bestseller.

title.children: The best summer reads from Liane Moriarty, Dolly Alderton and more

props.synopsis: Donald Trump wants to impose a 25% tax on imports from Canada and Mexico which will have huge implications for the American economy. If You're Listening examines what can we understand about tariffs from Australia’s recent past.

title.children: If You're Listening: Will Trump's tariffs make America expensive again?
